definitions: To assume the role of the antagonist or villain in a situation.
To be the person who delivers bad news or enforces unpopular rules.
To take on the unpleasant or difficult task of being the disciplinarian or enforcer.
examples: Someone had to play the heavy and tell them the project was canceled.
He always ends up playing the heavy when it comes to budget cuts.
I don't want to play the heavy, but we need to stick to the schedule.
